alert.note: Alert for Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 10:58AM EST until March 07 at 2:12AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Maumee River at Napoleon affecting Henry County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maumee River at Napoleon. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Recreational campgrounds near Napoleon begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:32 AM EST Saturday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 13.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
